description.narrative:
Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Roma Education Fund, REF, aims at increasing the level of Education of Europe's Roma population. Through the means of providing project grants, scholarships and through research and policy work REF contributes to increase the number of Roma achieving qualitative education at all levels in the education cycle, from pre-school to post-graduate studies.
Distribution: No country allocations in advance.

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 REFs, d.v.s. Roma Education Funds, verksamhet syftar till att höja utbildningsnivån för romer i Europa. Sida avser ge kärnstöd till REF, vars verksamhet består i att genom projektbidrag, stipendier, forskning och påverkansarbete öka antalet romer som får kvalitativ utbildning från förskola ända upp till doktorsgrad. Sida avser finansiera verksamhet i alla de ODA-klassade länder som REF är verksamt i, d.v.s. i Albanien, Bosnien Herzegovina, Kosovo, Makedonien, Montenegro, Serbien, Turkiet, Moldavien och Ukraina. Sida har i flera år gett projektstöd till REF men bedömer nu att REF som organisation är mogen att hantera kärnstöd. REFs kapacitet att hantera medel på ett ansvarsfullt sätt samt organisationens förmåga att bedriva sin verksamhet gör att Sida bedömer den sammantagna risken för insatsen vara låg.

To close the gap in educational outcomes between Roma and non-Roma. REF contributes to SDG 4 - ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all. The REF strategic framework 2021 - 2030 sets out three strategic orientations: i) supporting individual beneficiaries,ii) utilizing/sensitizing education systems through advocating the needs and interests of Roma,iii) making REF a specialised organisation for the mobilization of the human potential of Roma and their contribution pedagogy.

description.narrative: REF has foundations/offices in six countries. Sida funding only goes to ODA-countries. For 2019, Sida funds corresponded to 10.4% of all received funds for REF-Suisse, and for the period 2015-2019 it corresponded to 9.6%. The major donor to REF-Suisse is Open Society Foundation (OSF) (covers 72,5% of funds during 2015-2019 period). The second largest donor is Swiss Agency for Development (SDC) followed by Sida. In 2019, REF continued to implement its core activities through grants-giving and distribution of scholarships. REF issued a competitive call for grants in the Western Balkans which were supposed to be aligned with the new Strategic Framework. Out of 49 applications received, REF granted ten grants to grassroots organisations. Additionally, based on the invitation and ongoing Memorandum of Understanding, REF granted funds to the Ministry of Labor and Social Policy in North Macedonia and to the Central European University. For Romani students in tertiary education, REF provided 1,633 scholarships, out of which 340 were distributed to students from the Western Balkans. Additionally, REF granted an advocacy grant to NGOs EduRoma in Slovakia and Mesecina in North Macedonia. REF also continued implementation of the EU Regional Action for Roma Education: Increased Education Opportunities for Roma Students and Roma Youth in Western Balkans and Turkey which seeks to reduce the gap between Roma and non-Roma in participation and completion of quality ender-senducation through gesitive programming, to improve Roma students’ transition between education and employment and to promote durable systemic change and desegregation of education systems. In Serbia, REF commenced the second phase of the project Improved Education and Integration Opportunities for Roma in Serbia, Employment Empowerment of Young Roma and Reintegration of Returnees financed by the German Development Bank. In 2019, the Board of REF decided that the organisation headquarters would be moved to Belgrade. Projects implemented by REF Hungary will be also moved to REF Serbia based on the agreements with the donors. The preparation works and the transition is implemented until the end of 2020.
